Title: Student and Staff Computing Devices
Bid Submission Type: Online via iSupplier portal or Manual Submission (Mail/FedEx/UPS)
Term of Bid: Three (3) year agreement with two (2) successive one (1) year extensions, not to exceed five (5) years total.
Pre Bid Meeting: June 10, 2024 at 2:00 PM CST via TEAMS
Installation: All deliveries and deployments must incorporate white glove services, which include asset decaling, asset reporting, etching (for Laptops only), and delivery to varied locations. For Windows devices, autopilot enrollment is required. For Chromebooks, enrollment in Google Management is required.
Delivery Date: Quotes for different projects from awarded vendors will be requested starting in September of 2024.
Any Additional Documentation Required: Factory-authorized repair and maintenance certifications (for resellers)
Additional warranty information and pricing can be submitted as an attachment
Contract or Cooperative to use: Dallas ISD is a member of the Educational Purchasing Cooperative of North Texas (EPCNT) and the Central Texas Purchasing Alliance (CTPA), and other governmental entities may be eligible to purchase under the awarded contract.
Product: Student and staff computing devices, including laptops, desktops, tablet devices, display monitors, and related accessories.
Bid Summary: This Request for Proposal (RFP) is for a multi-year contract for student and staff computing devices, including laptops, desktops, tablet devices, and display monitors. Dallas ISD intends to award contracts to single or multiple vendors per device category. The specifications provided are minimum hardware requirements. Awarded vendors will be requested to provide competitive quotes for various projects over the life of the contract. Required services include white glove deployment, which involves asset decaling, reporting, etching for laptops, and specific software setup like Autopilot for Windows and Google Management for Chromebooks. The contract term is for three years with two optional one-year extensions.

Tier 1 Small Student Chromebook Laptop.Processor: Intel Celeron Processor N100 or equivalent
Tier 1 Small Student Chromebook Laptop.Ports: Minimum 2 USB 3.0; type C; 1 headphone/microphone combo

Tier 2 Large Student Chromebook Laptop.Processor: Intel Celeron Processor N100 or equivalent
Tier 2 Large Student Chromebook Laptop.Ports: Minimum 2 USB 3.0; 1 Type C; HDMI; 1 headphone/microphone combo

Tier 3 Student Windows Laptop.Management: Enterprise Management Ready w/ Autopilot Enrollment
Tier 3 Student Windows Laptop.Ports: Minimum 2 USB 3.0; 1 Type C; HDMI; 1 headphone/microphone combo

Student Tablet.Ports: 1 headphone or other personal audio connection

Tier 1 Staff Windows Basic Desktop.Management: Enterprise Management Ready with Autopilot Enrollment
Tier 1 Staff Windows Basic Desktop.Processor: Intel i5 Processor, 14th Gen or equivalent
Tier 1 Staff Windows Basic Desktop.Ports: Minimum 3 USB 3.0; 2 USB-C; 1 HDMI; 1 headphone/microphone combo

Tier 2 Staff Professional Desktop.Processor: Intel i7 Processor, 14th Gen or equivalent
Tier 2 Staff Professional Desktop.Ports: Minimum 3 USB 3.0; 1 USB-C, 1 HDMI; 1 headphone/microphone combo

Tier 1 Staff Basic Laptop.Processor: Intel i5 CPU, 14th Gen or equivalent
Tier 1 Staff Basic Laptop.Ports: Minimum 1 USB 3.0; 1 USB-C, 1 HDMI; 1 headphone/microphone combo

Tier 2 Staff Laptop.Processor: Intel i7 CPU, 14th Gen or equivalent

General Requirements.Warranty: All warranties must be made by the OEM. Standard warranty is 1-year for student Chromebooks and 3 years for student/staff Windows laptops. Accidental Damage Protection is not required.
General Requirements.Equipment: All equipment must be new and of the manufacturer's current model in production at time of order.
General Requirements.Repairs: Warranty service, repairs, or replacements to be performed at no cost within 5 business days. A temporary hot swap device is expected if repair takes longer.
